name: Invoice Redirection Fraud
description: Fraudster impersonates a supplier and requests payment to a different account, often claiming updated bank details.
recommended_action: Contact the supplier using known contact details to verify the payment request. Never use contact information from the suspicious message.

name: CEO/Executive Impersonation
description: Fraudster impersonates a company executive to authorize urgent, confidential payments bypassing normal approval processes.
recommended_action: Verify the request directly with the executive through a known phone number. Do not respond to the suspicious message.

name: Supplier Impersonation
description: Fraudster creates a similarly-named company or spoofs a legitimate supplier to intercept payments.
recommended_action: Verify the supplier's bank details match your records. Call the supplier using contact information from your files, not from the message.

name: Advance Fee Fraud
description: Victim is asked to pay upfront fees, taxes, or deposits to receive a larger sum, prize, or service that never materializes.
recommended_action: Be highly suspicious of requests for upfront payments. Legitimate transactions do not require advance fees to release funds.

name: Overpayment Scam
description: Fraudster sends a payment larger than required and asks for the difference to be refunded, typically using fraudulent funds.
recommended_action: Wait for the original payment to fully clear before issuing any refunds. Verify the payment source is legitimate.

name: After-Hours Transaction
description: Transaction initiated outside normal business hours may indicate unauthorized access or social engineering attack.
recommended_action: Confirm you authorized this transaction. Review recent account activity and check for unauthorized access.

name: Significant Amount Deviation
description: Transaction amount is significantly higher than typical spending patterns, which may indicate fraud or error.
recommended_action: Verify this is an expected payment and the amount is correct before authorizing.

name: Tech Support Scam
description: Fraudster poses as technical support and convinces victim to make payments for fake services or software.
recommended_action: Legitimate tech companies do not cold-call customers. Contact the company directly using official channels.

name: Mandate Fraud
description: Fraudster intercepts or manipulates payment instructions to redirect funds to their account.
recommended_action: Verify any requests to change payment details through a secondary channel. Implement dual authorization for payment changes.

name: Rapid Transaction Pattern
description: Multiple transactions in quick succession may indicate automated fraud or account takeover.
recommended_action: Review all recent transactions. Consider temporarily freezing the account and resetting credentials.
